org.senchalabs.gwt.gwtdriver.models

Class WidgetContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.senchalabs.gwt.gwtdriver.models.GwtWidget<GwtWidgetFinder<WidgetContainer>>
      • org.senchalabs.gwt.gwtdriver.models.WidgetContainer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GwtRootPanel

    public class WidgetContainer
extends GwtWidget<GwtWidgetFinder<WidgetContainer>>
    A Widget that can contain more widgets. A GWT widget type need not implement or extend anything to be mapped to this, but likely implements HasWidgets.

    The main way to use this type is to invoke findWidget(By) and findWidgets(By). These methods are like WebElement's findElement and findElements - they accept a By, but instead of returning one or more WebElement instances, they return GwtWidget. These objects can be transformed into specific subclasses via the GwtWidget.as(Class) method.

      • findWidgets

        public List<GwtWidget<?>> findWidgets(org.openqa.selenium.By by)
        Convenience method to find child/descendant widgets and wrap them. Same semantics as WebElement.findElements(By) - can be used to find if nothing matches this By.
        Parameters:
        by -
        Returns:

      • findWidget

        public GwtWidget<?> findWidget(org.openqa.selenium.By by)
                        throws org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException
        Convenience method to find a specific child/descendant widgets and wrap it. Same semantics as WebElement.findElement(By) - will throw an exception if nothing matches.

        by -

        Throws:
